en:
Leto, standing 3/4-view to the right, with her weight on her left leg,
      wearing a star-patterned himation over her shoulders, veiled over her head, and a
      medium-sleeved chiton (?), a leafy wreath over a taenia, pours a libation from a phiale held
      in her right hand, and raises her left hand, palm out; a small deer prances profile to the
      right, and raises its head and left front leg; a fruitful palm tree; Apollo Kitharoidos
      standing profile to the right, wearing a star-patterned himation, olive wreath over his long
      hair, holds a kithara in his bent left arm, and reaches his bent right arm to the right,
      pouring a libation from a phiale held in his right hand, over a low brazier; Artemis standing
      3/4-view to the left, with her weight on her right leg, himation over her left shoulder and
      around her waist, wearing a short-sleeved chiton, a red taenia with white rays, her hair in a
      bun, quiver and bow on her back, holds an oinochoe in her lowered right hand, and an enflamed
      torch in her lowered left hand; fruitful olive tree; Delos (labelled) seated 3/4-view to the
      left on an omphalos (around which is tied a wreath and a chain), legs crossed, wearing a
      sleeveless, belted chiton with cross-straps, a star-pattern himation around her lower body,
      pulled up her back and the back of her head, a rayed stephane over hair tied in a bun, a black
      snake bracelet on each wrist, holds a phiale to the left in her right hand, and raises her
      left hand, of which the palm faces out; Hermes, standing near profile to the left, with his
      right foot raised on low rock, wearing calf-length strap-boots, a chlamys bound in front of
      his neck, a winged pilos, rests his left hand on hip, and his right elbow on his right knee,
      and holds a kerykeion in his right hand; tripod.

<bibl>Shapiro 1988</bibl>, 206; <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 3.368
      s.v. Delos 1 no. 1, pl. 270 (P. Bruneau); P. Bruneau, "Deliaca. Iconographie. L'image de Dlos
      personnifie e la pyxide de Spina," <hi rend="ital">BCH</hi> 109 (1985) 551-56; H.
      Gallet de Santerre, <hi rend="ital">Rayonnement grec. Hommages Ch. Delvoye</hi>
      (Paris 1982) 214-15; <bibl>Add</bibl>, 178; H. Gallet de Santerre, "Athnes, Dlos
      et Delphes d'aprs une peinture de vase figures rouges du Ve sicle avant J.-C.," <hi
      rend="ital">BCH</hi> 100 (1976) 291-98; G. Riccioni, "Delos e i Letoidi offerenti in
      una pyxis di Spina," <hi rend="ital">Arte antica e moderna</hi> 1966, 173-81 pls.
      70-72; N. Alfieri and P.E. Arias, <hi rend="ital">Spina. Guida al Museo archeologico di
      Ferrara</hi> (Florence 1960) pl. 69.
